elements.name: werePOPartiesMarriedFAQ
elements.title: What is a spouse?
elements.body:
Spouses can include both married and unmarried individuals. A spouse is a person:
  • who is married to another person, or
  • has lived with another person in a marriage-like relationship (commonly called a common law relationship), and
    1. has lived with the other person for at least 2 years without a break, or
    2. has a child with the other person

elements.name: ExistingOrders
elements.title: Are there any existing written agreements or court `order`(s) about the child(ren) concerning parenting arrangements, child `support`, contact with a child or guardianship of a child?
elements.description: A written agreement includes a separation agreement or mediation agreement. A court order made be from any court in any place, including the Supreme Court.

elements.name: ExplanationExistingOrders
elements.title: You will need to include a photocopy of your written agreement(s) or court order(s) when you file your documents at the courthouse. You will be reminded to make a photocopy at the end of the service.
